definition[0]: a sudden very large fall in the price, value, or condition of something
example[0]: The pound took a nosedive on the foreign exchange market today.
example[1]: The economy went into a nosedive.
definition[1]: a sudden steep drop made by a plane with its front end pointing towards the ground
example[2]: Everyone screamed as the plane suddenly went into a nosedive.
definition[2]: if a price, value, or condition of something nosedives, it suddenly goes down or gets much worse
definition[3]: if a plane nosedives, it drops suddenly and steeply with its front end pointing towards the ground
definition[4]: if sales, exports, shares etc nosedive, their value or number falls suddenly and by a large amount
example[4]: In Hong Kong, stocks nosedived in active trading.
example[5]: The corporate banking unitâ€™s profit nosedived 74%, to $20 million.
